timeline.bodyText: While making these volatile might improve the situation, it will not solve it completely, since the ++ unary operator is not atomic.  I would suggest changing these to use AtomicInteger.
timeline.author: pferraro

replies.bodyText: Since this is a singleton ejb with container-managed concurrency, all method access are serialized and no two methods will be accessing the instance state. So I think make them volatile should work. If you agree, we can add volatile to messages field as well.
replies.author: chengfang

replies.bodyText: OK - in that case, volatile is sufficient.  messages should not need to be volatile since the list, while mutable, is effectively final.
replies.author: pferraro

timeline.bodyText: I suspect this might need to use a concurrent collection (or at least synchronized wrapper).
timeline.author: pferraro
